page.title: 06BARNSLEY CHURCH CONTINUED
page.content: Tourists visit the church and the visitors' book goes back to 1941.It begins with 'Robert of Austria', but we do not know who he was. There have been 110 visitors already this year, in the first six months. The furthest ones come from Canada and the U.S.A. There may be more American visitors because of the U.S.A.F. base at Fairford. One lady came from Sydney, Australia, and wrote that she was the great grand-daughter of Rev. George Vidal, Rector of Barnsley in the first quarter of this century. Mr. Michael Ward is the vicar of Barnsley, Winson and Bibury churches. Apart from running the churches, he also talks to people and helps people with their problems, and he has just made the church in Winson a retired nuns' home, but he generally runs and looks after the churches.
